result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald L. Werdin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined at a hearing to be held on December 8, 2016 at 1:00 pm. **On December 8, 2015 the court held a hearing and ordered restitution in the amount of $4,750.00 to be paid at the rate of $190.00 per month commencing August 1, 2016 and each month until paid in full.   In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent and/or current treating physician. Defendant is to take all prescribed medications in the manner and quantity as prescribed by his treating physician.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald L. Werdin

records.addlTxt: Discharge Regular - Per e-mail from Agent Dornfeld, defendant has paid the restitution in full. PRH removed from the calendar.
Probation review hearing on September 30, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:59 a.m. Defendant Ronald L. Werdin in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Kari Stockwell present on behalf of the Department of Corrections. Statement by Agent Stockwell - DE has been making $25 monthly payments as that is all that he can afford. ADA Anderson requesting an extension based on the amount of restitution that is still owed. Statement by DE - only source of income is social security. The Court orders an extension of probation for a period of two years and reimposes the previous order of $190 monthly payments.
Probation review hearing on September 14, 2017 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 1:10 pm case called. Defendant Ronald L. Werdin in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader. Statement by Attorney Selsing. Court makes statement regarding testimony today and the court will address the restitution for B. Tiffany's request for restitution. Court will not address the request made at the 11th hour by the other victim Cihlar. State calls B. Tiffany, witness sworn by clerk, testimony given. Exhibits #1, #2, #3, #4, #5, #6 offered and received by Court. 1:45 pm Cross exam by Attorney Selsing. Witness excused at 1:52 pm. Defendant called by Attorney Selsing. Cross exam by DA Blader. Witness excused at 2:02 pm. Argument by DA Blader. Argument by Attorney Selsing. Court makes statement and enters an order of restitution in the amount of $4,750.00. Court sets re-payment of restitution at the amount of $190.00 per month to commence August 1, 2016. Court adjourns at 2:15 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 1:30 pm case called. Defendant Ronald L. Werdin in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. Preliminary hearing discussed and waived. Court accepts waiver. Information filed. Attorney Selsing confirms receipt and waives formal reading. DA moves to amend information to allege one count of Causing Great Bodily Harm causing Negligence by use of a Motor Vehicle under 346.62(4).   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Selsing. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 60 days WCJ, to begin no later than October 24, 2015 at 8:00 pm. With Huber and Good Time Credit.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is to take any prescriptions as prescribed by any treating physician. Pay Restitution, to be determined on December 8, 2016 at 1:00 pm. Terms of Agent. Anger management as prescribed by Agent in conjunction with treatement defendant currently is attending.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Selsing request Plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Offer exchanged. Attorney Selsing regarding status of defendant-requests status.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 09:05 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Ronald L. Werdin in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   ADA argues as to bond - $2500 Signature Bond w/Conditions.  Atty Selsing has no objection as to bond requests.  The Court:  Orders $2500 Signature Bond with conditions as requested.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:50 am.
